pageContext.claim: “Two days ago, we had a judge ruled against us because he said he doesn't want people staying in Mexico. Mexico is too dangerous. Let them come in here. This is crazy. It's crazy.”
pageContext.analysis: This is not what U.S. District Judge Richard G. Seeborg said in his April 8 opinion. Seeborg granted a preliminary injunction, temporarily blocking the Trump administration's "Remain in Mexico" policy of sending Central American asylum-seekers to Mexico while they wait for a resolution to their asylum cases in the United States. A preliminary injunction is a common tool for judges, and it's in effect only while the legal case is resolved. Seeborg did not rule on the merits of the program, though he found that the Trump administration was not likely to succeed on the merits.
